Where can I park in Whitstable?

acceptedAnswer.text: The main car parks in Whitstable are: Gorrell Tank Car Park (CT5 1BU), Harbour Car Park (CT5 1AB), and Stream Walk Car Park (CT5 1BT). Most charge around Â£1-2 per hour. The harbour car park fills up quickly on sunny days, so arrive early or try Stream Walk for more availability.

mainEntity.name: What are the best independent shops in Whitstable?

acceptedAnswer.text: Whitstable's high street is home to dozens of independent shops including boutiques, art galleries, bookshops, and homeware stores. Browse our full directory at whitstable.shop to discover them all.
The Whitstable Oyster Festival typically takes place in late July each year, celebrating the town's oyster heritage with parades, live music, food stalls, and of course, plenty of oysters.

mainEntity.name: How do I get to Whitstable from London?

acceptedAnswer.text: The fastest way is by train from London St Pancras or Victoria to Whitstable station (approximately 1 hour 15 minutes). By car, take the M2 and A299 (about 1.5 hours depending on traffic).

mainEntity.name: Are dogs allowed on Whitstable beach?

acceptedAnswer.text: Dogs are restricted from the main Tankerton beach (between the castle and Long Rock) from 1st May to 30th September. However, they're welcome year-round on West Beach and the areas east of Long Rock.
